page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: In our survey we asked a sample of 100 people about their attitudes to religion. Of the 100 interviewed, 74 said they were Christians. The remaining 26 either did not believe in any God or were of a non-Christian denomination. Of the 74 Christians, 45 were Church of Scotland, 23 were Roman Catholics and the rest were from smaller congregations, including 3 Church of England. Of the non-Christians, 2 said they were Jewish, 2 Muslim, the rest specified 'other.' Twenty three said they never go to church, 11 said they go to weddings, funerals etc. 5 go about once a year(mainly at Christmas), 11 go about once a month and the rest go more often.
